events.originalText: Anti-government protests calling for free and fair elections began in Baku, Azerbaijan.
events.subtitle: 2019 Baku protests
events.headline: Anti-government protests erupt in Baku, Azerbaijan

events.originalText: Yemen War: A funeral in Sanaa was hit by two consecutive airstrikes  by a Saudi-led coalition, leaving 143–155 civilians dead and more than 525 injured.
events.subtitle: Saudi-led intervention in the Yemeni civil war
events.headline: Yemen War: Saudi-led coalition airstrikes hit funeral in Sanaa, leaving over 140 dead

events.originalText: At Linate Airport in Milan, Italy, Scandinavian Airlines Flight SK686 collided on take-off with a Cessna Citation II business jet, killing 118 people.
events.subtitle: Linate Airport
events.headline: Tragic collision at Linate Airport in Milan kills 118

events.originalText: A new airport for Oslo, Norway, opened at Gardermoen, replacing a smaller one at the same location that had served as a backup to the city's previous main airport at Fornebu.
events.subtitle: Oslo
events.headline: New airport opens in Oslo, Norway at Gardermoen

events.originalText: Demonstrations organized by the Weather Underground known as the Days of Rage began in Chicago, aimed at ending U.S. involvement in the Vietnam War.
events.subtitle: Weather Underground
events.headline: Days of Rage demonstrations begin in Chicago by Weather Underground

events.originalText: Marxist revolutionary and guerrilla leader Che Guevara was captured near La Higuera, Bolivia.
events.subtitle: Marxism
events.headline: Che Guevara captured near La Higuera, Bolivia

events.originalText: Three trains collided (aftermath pictured) at Harrow & Wealdstone station in London, killing 112 people and injuring 340 others.* 1956 – Major League Baseball pitcher Don Larsen threw the only perfect game in World Series history.
events.subtitle: Harrow and Wealdstone rail crash
events.headline: Deadly train collision at Harrow & Wealdstone station in London

events.originalText: The Indian Air Force was founded as an auxiliary air force of the British Royal Air Force.
events.subtitle: Indian Air Force
events.headline: Indian Air Force founded as auxiliary air force of British Royal Air Force

events.originalText: World War I: After his platoon suffered heavy casualties during the Meuse–Argonne offensive in France's Forest of Argonne, American Corporal Alvin York led the 7 remaining men on an attack against a German machine gun nest; 25 German soldiers were killed and 132 captured.
events.subtitle: World War I
events.headline: American Corporal Alvin York leads attack in Meuse–Argonne offensive

events.originalText: Five large fires broke out in the United States, including the Great Chicago Fire in Illinois and the Peshtigo fire in Wisconsin, the latter being the deadliest in U.S. history.
events.subtitle: Great Chicago Fire
events.headline: Multiple large fires break out in the United States

events.originalText: The Battle of Perryville, a battle of the American Civil War with a high casualty count, was fought west of Perryville, Kentucky.
events.subtitle: Battle of Perryville
events.headline: Battle of Perryville results in high casualties during American Civil War

events.originalText: Kepler's Supernova (remnant pictured), the most recent supernova in the Milky Way, was observed worldwide.
events.subtitle: Kepler's Supernova
events.headline: Kepler's Supernova observed worldwide in Milky Way

events.originalText: The Council of Chalcedon, a Christian ecumenical council, opened, and went on to repudiate the Eutychian doctrine of monophysitism and set forth the Chalcedonian Creed.
events.subtitle: Council of Chalcedon
events.headline: Council of Chalcedon opens to repudiate Eutychian doctrine
